documents.title: Engineering Onboarding Guide
documents.author: Sarah Williams
documents.content:
# Engineering Onboarding

## Welcome!
Welcome to the engineering team.

## Getting Started
1. Set up your development environment
2. Clone the repositories
3. Run the local setup script

## Key Contacts
- Engineering Manager: Marcus Chen
- Senior Dev: Sarah Williams

## Resources
- Documentation wiki
- Slack channels: #engineering, #general

documents.title: System Architecture Overview
documents.author: Priya Sharma
documents.content:
# Architecture Overview

## Components
- API Gateway
- Authentication Service  
- Database (PostgreSQL)
- Cache (Redis)
- Message Queue

## Data Flow
1. Request -> API Gateway
2. Authentication check
3. Business logic
4. Database/Cache operations
5. Response

## Monitoring
- Prometheus metrics
- Grafana dashboards
- PagerDuty alerts

documents.title: Post-Mortem: Payment Gateway Timeout
documents.author: Marcus Chen
documents.content:
# Post-Mortem: Payment Gateway Timeout

**Date**: 2024-10-17
**Severity**: P1
**Duration**: 2 day(s)
**Author**: Marcus Chen

## Summary
Payment processing failing due to gateway timeouts causing order failures

## Timeline
- **2024-10-17 09:00**: Issue first detected with payment
- **2024-10-17 09:30**: Team alerted, investigation started
- **2024-10-17 12:00**: Root cause identified - gateway
- **2024-10-17 14:00**: Fix deployed, monitoring started

## Root Cause
The issue was caused by problems with payment. Specifically, Payment processing failing due to gateway timeouts causing order failures

Technical details:
- Component affected: payment
- Related systems: gateway, timeout

## Resolution
Fixed by updating the payment handling logic. Changes deployed via PR.

## Action Items
1. Add better monitoring for payment
2. Update runbook for orders issues
3. Review payment configuration

## Related Links
- Jira: ENG-1
- GitHub PR: #101
- Slack Thread: #INC001

## Keywords
payment, gateway, timeout, stripe, checkout, orders

## Lessons Learned
- Need faster alerting for payment failures
- Documentation for orders should be improved
- Consider adding redundancy for payment

documents.title: Runbook: Payment Issues
documents.author: Alex Rodriguez
documents.content:
# Runbook: Payment Issues

**Last Updated**: 2024-10-21
**Author**: Alex Rodriguez

## Overview
This runbook covers troubleshooting for payment related issues.

## Common Issues

### Payment Gateway Timeout
**Symptoms**: Payment processing failing due to gateway timeouts causing order failures
**Keywords**: payment, gateway, timeout, stripe, checkout, orders

**Steps to Diagnose**:
1. Check payment metrics in dashboard
2. Review logs for payment errors
3. Verify gateway settings

**Resolution Steps**:
1. If payment is failing, check connection settings
2. Restart the payment service if needed
3. Escalate to on-call if issue persists

## Monitoring
- Alert: `payment_error_rate > threshold`
- Dashboard: payment Health

## Escalation
- L1: On-call engineer
- L2: Alex Rodriguez (alex@acmecorp.com)
- L3: Engineering Manager

## Related Incidents
- INC001: Payment Gateway Timeout

documents.title: Post-Mortem: User Session Expiry Bug
documents.author: Sarah Williams
documents.content:
# Post-Mortem: User Session Expiry Bug

**Date**: 2024-10-22
**Severity**: P2
**Duration**: 3 day(s)
**Author**: Sarah Williams

## Summary
Users getting logged out unexpectedly after 5 minutes instead of 24 hours

## Timeline
- **2024-10-22 09:00**: Issue first detected with session
- **2024-10-22 09:30**: Team alerted, investigation started
- **2024-10-22 12:00**: Root cause identified - logout
- **2024-10-22 14:00**: Fix deployed, monitoring started

## Root Cause
The issue was caused by problems with session. Specifically, Users getting logged out unexpectedly after 5 minutes instead of 24 hours

Technical details:
- Component affected: session
- Related systems: logout, auth

## Resolution
Fixed by updating the session handling logic. Changes deployed via PR.

## Action Items
1. Add better monitoring for session
2. Update runbook for jwt issues
3. Review session configuration

## Related Links
- Jira: ENG-4
- GitHub PR: #102
- Slack Thread: #INC002

## Keywords
session, logout, auth, token, expiry, jwt

## Lessons Learned
- Need faster alerting for session failures
- Documentation for jwt should be improved
- Consider adding redundancy for session

# Runbook: Session Issues

**Author**: Jamie Park

## Overview
This runbook covers troubleshooting for session related issues.

## Common Issues

### User Session Expiry Bug

documents.title: Post-Mortem: Email Notification Failure
documents.author: Alex Rodriguez
documents.content:
# Post-Mortem: Email Notification Failure

**Date**: 2024-11-05
**Severity**: P1
**Duration**: 1 day(s)
**Author**: Alex Rodriguez

## Summary
Transactional emails not being sent - SES rate limit exceeded

## Timeline
- **2024-11-05 09:00**: Issue first detected with email
- **2024-11-05 09:30**: Team alerted, investigation started
- **2024-11-05 12:00**: Root cause identified - notification
- **2024-11-05 14:00**: Fix deployed, monitoring started

## Root Cause
The issue was caused by problems with email. Specifically, Transactional emails not being sent - SES rate limit exceeded

Technical details:
- Component affected: email
- Related systems: notification, ses

## Resolution
Fixed by updating the email handling logic. Changes deployed via PR.

## Action Items
1. Add better monitoring for email
2. Update runbook for sendgrid issues
3. Review email configuration

## Related Links
- Jira: ENG-10
- GitHub PR: #104
- Slack Thread: #INC004

## Keywords
email, notification, ses, rate limit, queue, sendgrid

## Lessons Learned
- Need faster alerting for email failures
- Documentation for sendgrid should be improved
- Consider adding redundancy for email

documents.title: Post-Mortem: Search Index Corruption
documents.author: Sarah Williams
documents.content:
# Post-Mortem: Search Index Corruption

**Date**: 2024-11-18
**Severity**: P2
**Duration**: 2 day(s)
**Author**: Sarah Williams

## Summary
Elasticsearch index corrupted causing search to return stale results

## Timeline
- **2024-11-18 09:00**: Issue first detected with search
- **2024-11-18 09:30**: Team alerted, investigation started
- **2024-11-18 12:00**: Root cause identified - elasticsearch
- **2024-11-18 14:00**: Fix deployed, monitoring started

## Root Cause
The issue was caused by problems with search. Specifically, Elasticsearch index corrupted causing search to return stale results

Technical details:
- Component affected: search
- Related systems: elasticsearch, index

## Resolution
Fixed by updating the search handling logic. Changes deployed via PR.

## Action Items
1. Add better monitoring for search
2. Update runbook for corrupted issues
3. Review search configuration

## Related Links
- Jira: ENG-16
- GitHub PR: #106
- Slack Thread: #INC006

## Keywords
search, elasticsearch, index, reindex, stale, corrupted

## Lessons Learned
- Need faster alerting for search failures
- Documentation for corrupted should be improved
- Consider adding redundancy for search

documents.title: Post-Mortem: API Rate Limiting Bypass
documents.author: Sarah Williams
documents.content:
# Post-Mortem: API Rate Limiting Bypass

**Date**: 2024-11-25
**Severity**: P1
**Duration**: 2 day(s)
**Author**: Sarah Williams

## Summary
Security issue - rate limiting can be bypassed using header manipulation

## Timeline
- **2024-11-25 09:00**: Issue first detected with security
- **2024-11-25 09:30**: Team alerted, investigation started
- **2024-11-25 12:00**: Root cause identified - rate limit
- **2024-11-25 14:00**: Fix deployed, monitoring started

## Root Cause
The issue was caused by problems with security. Specifically, Security issue - rate limiting can be bypassed using header manipulation

Technical details:
- Component affected: security
- Related systems: rate limit, bypass

## Resolution
Fixed by updating the security handling logic. Changes deployed via PR.

## Action Items
1. Add better monitoring for security
2. Update runbook for headers issues
3. Review security configuration

## Related Links
- Jira: ENG-19
- GitHub PR: #107
- Slack Thread: #INC007

## Keywords
security, rate limit, bypass, api, vulnerability, headers

## Lessons Learned
- Need faster alerting for security failures
- Documentation for headers should be improved
- Consider adding redundancy for security

documents.title: Post-Mortem: Database Connection Pool Exhaustion
documents.author: Alex Rodriguez
documents.content:
# Post-Mortem: Database Connection Pool Exhaustion

**Date**: 2024-12-03
**Severity**: P1
**Duration**: 2 day(s)
**Author**: Alex Rodriguez

## Summary
Connection pool maxed out during traffic spike causing 503 errors

## Timeline
- **2024-12-03 09:00**: Issue first detected with database
- **2024-12-03 09:30**: Team alerted, investigation started
- **2024-12-03 12:00**: Root cause identified - connection
- **2024-12-03 14:00**: Fix deployed, monitoring started

## Root Cause
The issue was caused by problems with database. Specifically, Connection pool maxed out during traffic spike causing 503 errors

Technical details:
- Component affected: database
- Related systems: connection, pool

## Resolution
Fixed by updating the database handling logic. Changes deployed via PR.

## Action Items
1. Add better monitoring for database
2. Update runbook for capacity issues
3. Review database configuration

## Related Links
- Jira: ENG-22
- GitHub PR: #108
- Slack Thread: #INC008

## Keywords
database, connection, pool, postgres, 503, capacity

## Lessons Learned
- Need faster alerting for database failures
- Documentation for capacity should be improved
- Consider adding redundancy for database

documents.title: Runbook: Database Issues
documents.author: Marcus Chen
documents.content:
# Runbook: Database Issues

**Last Updated**: 2024-12-07
**Author**: Marcus Chen

## Overview
This runbook covers troubleshooting for database related issues.

## Common Issues

### Database Connection Pool Exhaustion
**Symptoms**: Connection pool maxed out during traffic spike causing 503 errors
**Keywords**: database, connection, pool, postgres, 503, capacity

**Steps to Diagnose**:
1. Check database metrics in dashboard
2. Review logs for database errors
3. Verify connection settings

**Resolution Steps**:
1. If database is failing, check connection settings
2. Restart the database service if needed
3. Escalate to on-call if issue persists

## Monitoring
- Alert: `database_error_rate > threshold`
- Dashboard: database Health

## Escalation
- L1: On-call engineer
- L2: Marcus Chen (marcus@acmecorp.com)
- L3: Engineering Manager

## Related Incidents
- INC008: Database Connection Pool Exhaustion
